resources.string: Your payment will be made as soon as it is authorised.\n\nPlease note that this transaction will expire at 00:00 tonight.
%s payment to %s, account number %s was successful.
%s payment to %s, account number %s was successfully scheduled.\n\nYour IIP Reference Number is %s.
Available account balance exceeded. Please pick a different account to pay from, change the amounts to pay or remove beneficiaries.
Some of your beneficiaries don\'t have payment amounts entered. Please fill in these missing

Note that the transactions that were submitted as an immediate interbank payment will be processed after one hour. This payment can still be returned by the system if there are insufficient funds at the time of the payment.
1. Payment cut-off times are governed by Interbank clearing rules to which all SA banks adhere.

2. We do not validate the account name to confirm that the account number and name correspond. 

3. A credit transfer will be processed according to the account number entered. 

4. The total payment amount excludes future-dated payments.
We are having trouble connecting to our servers right now. Your payments was not made. Please try again later.

When an Immediate Interbank Payment (IIP) is used the transaction cannot be revoked, set aside or cancelled, as payment takes place immediately. IIP is more expensive than regular transactions, which is subject to a time delay. \'What are the charges?\' will display the fee of the transaction. If we deem it necessary to implement measures to combat fraud we can change the terms of IIP and delay immediate access of funds to beneficiaries. We will provide advance notice on our website.
Please enter a valid account number
Please select a valid account type
Please enter a valid beneficiary name
Please enter valid account holder name
Please enter a valid payment amount
Import beneficiaries from another bank account
Take a photograph to import beneficiaries
Import your beneficiaries from another bank account by simply taking a photo

Import beneficiaries from Standard Bank, FNB, Capitec or Nedbank. 

Log into your internet banking or app.

Go to the beneficiary that you want to import.

Take a photo or screenshot of only the beneficiary information on the screen.

You can turn your camera on its side to fit all your beneficiary details in the shot.
Take a photograph of your beneficiary
Hold your phone straight in front of the screen.\n\nEnsure that all of the beneficiary information is on the photograph.
Add a beneficiary to get started.\n\nImport a beneficiary by taking a photograph of a beneficiary in another bank account.
Please verify that the information imported is correct.\n\nAbsa cannot be held responsible for incorrect information captured.
Hold your phone straight in front of the screen.
Keep the browser and surrounding images out of view.
Ensure the photograph is not blurry.
Amount entered exceeds the payment limit.
The amount is more than your current limits. If you continue, we\'ll update your limit but you can always change it back later.
I accept the IIP terms of use

When an Immediate Interbank Payment (IIP) is used the transaction cannot be revoked, set aside or cancelled as the payment takes place immediately. An IIP will be more expensive than regular transactions which are subject to a time delay. The fees for IIP transactions are available on the Absa website (www.absa.co.za) under “What are the charges?”. We can change the terms of IIP and delay access of the funds to beneficiaries if we deem it necessary to implement measures to combat fraud. We will give you notice in advance on our website of any such changes

2. We do not validate the account name to confirm that the account number and name correspond. 

3. A credit transfer will be processed according to the account number entered. 

4. The total payment amount excludes future-dated payments.

When an Immediate Interbank Payment (IIP) is used the transaction cannot be revoked, set aside or cancelled as the payment takes place immediately. An IIP will be more expensive than regular transactions which are subject to a time delay. \n\nThe fees for IIP transactions are available on the Absa website (www.absa.co.za) under "What are the charges?”. We can change the terms of IIP and delay access of the funds to beneficiaries if we deem it necessary to implement measures to combat fraud. We will give you notice in advance on our website of any such changes.
